title: How The New York Times Investigated Videos of ICE Agents Killing Alex Pretti
summary: Using more than a dozen videos related to the shooting of Alex Pretti, The Times worked to establish what is called ground truth: what happened, how it happened and who might be responsible.

title: Winter Storm Debilitates the South, Encasing Cities in Ice and Snow
summary: The forecasts had predicted that the storm could be among the worst in a generation to hit the region. By Monday, it was clear that is exactly what happened.

title: Scenes From the Winter Storm
summary: Images from across much of the United States illuminate snow-covered streets and the storm’s aftermath.

title: How Does Climate Change Affect Winter Storms?
summary: A warmer atmosphere has the potential to hold more moisture, which can contribute to heavier precipitation in any season, scientists say.

title: Winter Storm Linked to at Least 22 Deaths in the US
summary: The storm deaths were reported in New York, Tennessee, Louisiana, Kansas, Texas, Massachusetts, Arkansas, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Mississippi, Kentucky and New Jersey, and other deaths were under investigation.

title: What to Expect for a Cold NYC Commute: Trains, Buses and Rail
summary: Mass transit is slowly getting back to normal around the city.

title: No Snow Day? In New York City Parks, It Felt Like One.
summary: Some children skipped remote classes in city schools in favor of activities they felt were more important: sledding and snowball fights.

title: After Mamdani Nods to ‘Heated Rivalry,’ Library E-Book Downloads Surge
summary: As a snowstorm arrived, Mayor Zohran Mamdani reminded New Yorkers that they could access the romance series that inspired the TV show through their public library.

title: Record Debt in the World’s Richest Nations Threatens Global Growth
summary: The cost of borrowing is already choking crucial public spending in many developing economies. Now it’s raising broader alarms.

title: Trump Says He Will Raise Tariffs on South Korea to 25%
summary: President Trump threatened to increase tariffs on South Korean exports, including cars, citing the country’s slow ratification of a trade deal.

title: UK Seeks Trade With China Without Triggering Trump’s Fury
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer hopes to boost his country’s lagging economy with a trip to Beijing. But he must carefully navigate between two superpowers.

title: Home Sourdough Bakers Are Turning Their Hobbies Into Full-Time Jobs
summary: Home bakers are finding devoted customer bases that allow them to stay home with family and still make a decent living — but they do have get up in the middle of the night.

title: Social Media Giants Face Landmark Legal Tests on Child Safety
summary: Starting this week, a series of trials will test a new legal strategy claiming that Meta, TikTok, Snap and YouTube caused personal injury through addictive products.

title: The Social Media Addiction Trials: What to Know
summary: Landmark trials beginning this week will test a new legal strategy claiming that Meta, TikTok, Snap and YouTube caused personal injury through addictive products.

title: Trump Briefed on Intelligence Saying Iran’s Government Is Weaker
summary: Protests that erupted late last year shook elements of the Iranian government, according to the reports.

title: Democrats Embrace a Shutdown Fight They Wanted to Avoid
summary: After a second fatal shooting of a U.S. citizen in Minneapolis, Democrats say public opinion is on their side and they are willing to risk a backlash to counter what they see as police-state tactics.

title: Court Affirms Ruling That Alina Habba Served Unlawfully as U.S. Attorney
summary: The Justice Department lost a bid to challenge a decision that had found Ms. Habba was serving unlawfully as New Jersey’s top federal prosecutor.

title: Trump Administration Takes Another Stake in Rare Earth Sector
summary: The administration announced a $1.6 billion deal with USA Rare Earth. The firm also does business with Cantor Fitzgerald, which is run by the sons of President Trump’s commerce secretary.

title: NATO Chief Says Europe Is ‘Dreaming’ if It Thinks It Can Defend Itself Without U.S.
summary: Mark Rutte, the secretary general of the alliance, told members of the European Parliament that President Trump was “doing a lot of good stuff.”

title: A Year After DC Plane Crash, Concerns About Airport’s Safety Continue
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration says it has reduced traffic in and out of the airport and designed safer routes. Crash victims’ families want more.

title: F.A.A. Rolls Out Agency Overhaul for Improving Air Safety
summary: The announcement of a reorganization comes nearly a year after a midair collision killed 67 people and prompted a public outcry for enhancing the security of aviation travel.

title: All-Night Concerts in War-Ravaged Myanmar
summary: But the shows, which combine dance, drama and music, are also part of an effort by Myanmar’s military rulers to project a veneer of legitimacy.

title: The Time Has Come for the U.S. to Act in Iran
summary: It is time for the U.S. to intervene militarily in Iran, at least to deter future killings of protesters.

title: The War in Minnesota Is for Our Phones
summary: We need to protect our right to carry cameras to document ICE’s violence.

title: How Bad Are A.I. Delusions? We Asked People Treating Them.
summary: Dozens of doctors and therapists said chatbots had led their patients to psychosis, isolation and unhealthy habits.

title: Chinese Pandas Leave Japanese Zoo
summary: As Japan and China feud, an animal long used in Chinese diplomacy has been summoned back home.

title: Thomas Fogarty, 91, Who Helped Revolutionize Vascular Surgery, Dies
summary: Drawing on his love of fly-fishing, he developed a balloon catheter that removes blood clots from patients’ limbs in a minimally invasive way. It has saved millions of lives.

title: Canada’s Marineland Whales Could Find New Homes in U.S.
summary: Marineland, a closed aquatic park in Ontario, had threatened to euthanize its whales after the government denied an application to send them to China.
